metadata.title: CVE-2017-7558 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A kernel data leak due to an out-of-bound read was found in the Linuxkernel in inet_diag_msg_sctp{,l}addr_fill() and sctp_get_sctp_info()functions present since version 4.7-rc1 through version 4.13. A data leakhappens when these functions fill in sockaddr data structures used toexport socket's diagnostic information. As a result, up to 100 bytes of theslab data could be leaked to a userspace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required
